title: Joaquín Guillén
text:
Joaquín Bernardo Guillén González (born 12 January 1968) is a retired Costa Rican <a href="association%20football">football</a> player.
He played most of his career at hometown club <a href="L.D.%20Alajuelense">Alajuelense</a>.
Club career.
Guillén totalled 331 league matches for "Liga". In summer 1998 he joined compatriots <a href="R%C3%B3nald%20G%C3%B3mez">Rónald Gómez</a> and <a href="Richard%20Smith%20%28Costa%20Rican%20footballer%29">Richard Smith</a> at Guatemalan side <a href="C.S.D.%20Municipal">Municipal</a>. He had a few seasons back at home with <a href="Santos%20de%20Gu%C3%A1piles">Santos de Guápiles</a>, moved to <a href="C.S.%20Cartagin%C3%A9s">Cartaginés</a> in January 2001 and joined <a href="Asociaci%C3%B3n%20Deportiva%20Carmelita">Carmelita</a> in summer 2001.
International career.
Guillén made his debut for <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a> in a November 1991 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against the <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States</a> and earned a total of 20 caps, scoring no goals. He represented his country in 2 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches and played at the <a href="1997%20UNCAF%20Nations%20Cup">1997 UNCAF Nations Cup</a>, the <a href="1998%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">1998 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a> and the <a href="1997%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">1997 Copa América</a>.
His final international was a February <a href="1998%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">1998 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a> match against the <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States</a>.
